data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.
from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: A lazy or shiftless person, especially one who seeks to live solely by the support of others.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: An incompetent, insignificant, or obnoxious person.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.
examples: The batter called the pitcher a bum.

data.text: One who spends a lot of time doing a particular recreational activity.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.
examples: a beach bum; a ski bum.

data.text: To live by begging and scavenging from place to place. Often used with around.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: To pass time idly; loaf. Often used with around.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: To acquire by begging; cadge. synonym: cadge.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: To depress, dishearten, or dismay. Often used with out.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.
from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.
examples: gave me bum advice; did a bum job of fixing the car.
